meanings.definition: A unit of electric potential equal to one millionth of a volt.
meanings.sent1: The electronic device measured the tiny amount of microvolts in the circuit.
meanings.sent2: The scientist recorded the microvolts to understand the electrical activity.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous robot tried to steal a few microvolts from the power source.
meanings.sent4: In the world of electronics, microvolts are like whispers in a crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The flickering lightbulb needed just a few more microvolts to shine brightly.

meanings.definition: A measurement of electrical potential in a circuit.
meanings.sent1: The technician carefully monitored the microvolts to prevent any power surges.
meanings.sent2: The multimeter displayed the microvolts accurately for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat accidentally caused a fluctuation in the microvolts while playing with wires.
meanings.sent4: The stability of the entire system depended on the precise control of microvolts.
meanings.sent5: The sudden drop in microvolts signaled a problem in the electrical grid.
